TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit JapaneseCalendar extends System.Globalization.Calendar

summary.span: 表示日本历。

span.span: Represents the Japanese calendar.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 日语日历，这是也称为 Wareki 日历，工作方式与公历，完全相同，只的年份和纪元不相同。The Japanese calendar, which is also known as the Wareki calendar, works exactly like the Gregorian calendar, except that the year and era are different. > [!NOTE] > 有关使用信息类和其他日历.NET Framework 中的类，请参阅[使用日历](~/docs/standard/datetime/working-with-calendars.md)。For information about using the class and the other calendar classes in the .NET Framework, see [Working with Calendars](~/docs/standard/datetime/working-with-calendars.md). 日语日历识别为每个皇帝 reign 一个纪元。The Japanese calendar recognizes one era for every emperor's reign. 当前纪元是平成纪元，始于公历 1989 年。The current era is the Heisei era, which began in the Gregorian calendar year 1989. 纪元名称通常会显示在年的前面。The era name is typically displayed before the year. 例如，公历 2001 年为日语日历年平成 13。For example, the Gregorian calendar year 2001 is the Japanese calendar year Heisei 13. 请注意，第一年的纪元称为"元年。"Note that the first year of an era is called "Gannen." 因此，公历 1989 年的日语日历平成元年。Therefore, the Gregorian calendar year 1989 was the Japanese calendar year Heisei Gannen. 此类将分配数字向纪元，如下所示：This class assigns numbers to the eras as follows: |GetEra 值GetEra value|纪元名称Era Name|纪元缩写Era Abbreviation|公历日期Gregorian Dates| |------------------|--------------|----------------------|---------------------| |44|平成 （平成）平成 (Heisei)|平 (H，h)平 (H, h)|年 1 月 8 日 1989 呈现January 8, 1989 to present| |33|昭和 (Showa)昭和 (Showa)|昭 （S、 s）昭 (S, s)|1926 年 12 月 25日，到 1989 年 1 月 7日日December 25, 1926 to January 7, 1989| |22|大正 (Taisho)大正 (Taisho)|大 （T、 t）大 (T, t)|1912 年 7 月 30日日到 1926 年 12 月 24日，July 30, 1912 to December 24, 1926| |11|明治 （明治）明治 (Meiji)|明 （M、 m）明 (M, m)|1868 年 9 月 8日日至 1912 年 7 月 29日日September 8, 1868 to July 29, 1912| 此类处理从 9 月 8 （在公历日历，1868 年 9 月 8 日） 的年份明治 1 中的日期。This class handles dates from September 8 in the year Meiji 1 (in the Gregorian calendar, September 8, 1868). 尽管日本历切换从阴历太阳能日历年明治 6 (1873 的公历) 中，此实现基于太阳能日历。Although the Japanese calendar was switched from a lunar calendar to a solar calendar in the year Meiji 6 (1873 of the Gregorian calendar), this implementation is based on the solar calendar only. 闰年日语日历中对应于为公历日历中的相同闰年。Leap years in the Japanese calendar correspond to the same leap years in the Gregorian calendar. 闰年公历日历中定义为公历年份整除的由 4 个，但如果它是由 100 可除外。A leap year in the Gregorian calendar is defined as a Gregorian year that is evenly divisible by four, except if it is divisible by 100. 但是，可被被 400 的公历年是闰年。However, Gregorian years that are divisible by 400 are leap years. 平 365 年天并且初始屏幕闰年有 366 天。A common year has 365 days and a leap year has 366 days. 日本历有 12 个月 28 到 31 天：The Japanese calendar has 12 months with 28 to 31 days each: |GetMonth 值GetMonth value|月份Month|英语English|天数在平年Days in common years|中的天闰年Days in leap years| |--------------------|-----------|-------------|--------------------------|------------------------| |11|1月 (Ichigatsu)1月 (Ichigatsu)|年 1 月January|3131|3131| |22|2月 (Nigatsu)2月 (Nigatsu)|年 2 月February|2828|2929| |33|3月 (Sangatsu)3月 (Sangatsu)|年 3 月March|3131|3131| |44|4月 (Shigatsu)4月 (Shigatsu)|年 4 月April|3030|3030| |55|5月 (Gogatsu)5月 (Gogatsu)|5 月May|3131|3131| |66|6月 (Rokugatsu)6月 (Rokugatsu)|JuneJune|3030|3030| |77|7月 (Shichigatsu)7月 (Shichigatsu)|年 7 月July|3131|3131| |88|8月 (Hachigatsu)8月 (Hachigatsu)|年 8 月August|3131|3131| |99|9月 (Kugatsu)9月 (Kugatsu)|年 9 月September|3030|3030| |1010|10月 (Juugatsu)10月 (Juugatsu)|年 10 月October|3131|3131| |1111|11月 (Juuichigatsu)11月 (Juuichigatsu)|年 11 月November|3030|3030| |1212|12月 (Juunigatsu)12月 (Juunigatsu)|年 12 月December|3131|3131| Nigatsu，相当于年 2 月的公历月份，具有在闰年 29 天和 28 在平年。Nigatsu, which is equivalent to the Gregorian calendar month of February, has 29 days during leap years and 28 during common years. 日期到公元 2001 年 1 月 1 日The date January 1, 2001 A.D. 在公历日历中相当 Ichigatsu 日语日历中每年平成 13 中的第一天。in the Gregorian calendar is equivalent to the first day of Ichigatsu in the year Heisei 13 in the Japanese calendar. 如果应用程序使用类，识别年份前面的纪元缩写。If the application is using the class, recognizes the era abbreviations in front of the year. 缩写是单字符不区分大小写拉丁字母缩写或单字符日文汉字缩写。The abbreviation is either the single-character case-insensitive Latin alphabet abbreviation or the single-character Kanji abbreviation. 每个对象支持一组的日历。Each object supports a set of calendars. 属性返回区域性的默认日历和属性返回一个包含所有支持的区域性的日历数组。The property returns the default calendar for the culture, and the property returns an array containing all the calendars supported by the culture. 若要更改使用的日历，应用程序应设置属性到新。To change the calendar used by a , the application should set the property of to a new .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 日部分的生成如果结果的日期不是有效的一天中生成月份影响。The day part of the resulting is affected if the resulting day is not a valid day in the resulting month of the resulting year. 它将更改为在生成每年的生成的每月最后一个有效的一天。It is changed to the last valid day in the resulting month of the resulting year. 所生成的年份部分如果外部的指定年，则结果月份受到。The year part of the resulting is affected if the resulting month is outside the year of the specified . 所生成的纪元部分如果所得年份未指定纪元影响。The era part of the resulting is affected if the resulting year is outside the era of the specified . 所生成的一天时间部分保持与指定相同。The time-of-day part of the resulting remains the same as the specified . 例如，如果指定的月份是 Juugatsu （年 10 月），有 31 天，则指定的日期是该月第 31 天和`months`为 6，则结果年份是一个多个指定的年份，生成的月份是 Shigatsu （年 4 月） 和结果的日期为 30 天，即 Shigatsu （年 4 月） 的最后一天。For example, if the specified month is Juugatsu (October), which has 31 days, the specified day is the 31st day of that month, and `months` is 6, the resulting year is one more than the specified year, the resulting month is Shigatsu (April), and the resulting day is the 30th day, which is the last day in Shigatsu (April). 如果`months`为负，生成早于指定。If `months` is negative, the resulting is earlier than the specified . 属性返回值始终等于。The property of the returned value always equals . 您可以保留属性`time`通过调用的参数方法，如以下示例所示。You can preserve the property of the `time` parameter by calling the method, as the following example shows. remarks.format: ## Remarks 日语日历识别为每个皇帝 reign 一个纪元。The Japanese calendar recognizes one era for every emperor's reign. 当前纪元是平成纪元，始于公历 1989 年。The current era is the Heisei era, which began in the Gregorian calendar year 1989. 纪元名称通常会显示在年的前面。The era name is typically displayed before the year. 例如，公历 2001 年为日语日历年平成 13。For example, the Gregorian calendar year 2001 is the Japanese calendar year Heisei 13. 请注意，第一年的纪元称为"元年。"Note that the first year of an era is called "Gannen." 因此，公历 1989 年的日语日历平成元年。Therefore, the Gregorian calendar year 1989 was the Japanese calendar year Heisei Gannen. 此类将分配数字向纪元，如下所示：This class assigns numbers to the eras as follows: |GetEra 值GetEra value|纪元名称Era Name|纪元缩写Era Abbreviation|公历日期Gregorian Dates| |------------------|--------------|----------------------|---------------------| |44|平成 （平成）平成 (Heisei)|平 (H，h)平 (H, h)|年 1 月 8 日 1989 呈现January 8, 1989 to present| |33|昭和 (Showa)昭和 (Showa)|昭 （S、 s）昭 (S, s)|1926 年 12 月 25日，到 1989 年 1 月 7日日December 25, 1926 to January 7, 1989| |22|大正 (Taisho)大正 (Taisho)|大 （T、 t）大 (T, t)|1912 年 7 月 30日日到 1926 年 12 月 24日，July 30, 1912 to December 24, 1926| |11|明治 （明治）明治 (Meiji)|明 （M、 m）明 (M, m)|1868 年 9 月 8日日至 1912 年 7 月 29日日September 8, 1868 to July 29, 1912| 此类处理从 9 月月 8 日的年份明治 1 (年 1 月 1，1868 公历) 中的日期。This class handles dates from September 8 in the year Meiji 1 (January 1, 1868 of the Gregorian calendar). 尽管日本历切换从阴历太阳能日历年明治 6 (1873 的公历) 中，此实现基于太阳能日历。Although the Japanese calendar was switched from a lunar calendar to a solar calendar in the year Meiji 6 (1873 of the Gregorian calendar), this implementation is based on the solar calendar only. > [!NOTE] > 应在将来添加其他纪元，应用程序可能会遇到多个为日语日历的预期四个纪元。Should additional eras be added in the future, applications may encounter more than the expected four eras for the Japanese calendar. 应用程序应进行测试，以确保它们持续这种情况下; 中的工作请参阅[纪元处理为日语日历](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=239618)。Applications should be tested to ensure that they continue to work in such an event; see [Era Handling for the Japanese Calendar](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=239618). ## Examples 下面的示例显示中包含的值属性。The following example displays the values contained in the property. [!code-cpp[System.Globalization.JapaneseCalendar.Eras#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.JapaneseCalendar.Eras/CPP/yslin_japanesecalendar_eras.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.JapaneseCalendar.Eras#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.JapaneseCalendar.Eras/CS/yslin_japanesecalendar_eras.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.JapaneseCalendar.Eras#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.JapaneseCalendar.Eras/VB/yslin_japanesecalendar_eras.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 每年的日期被指从该年度的第一天的天数。The day of the year is defined as the number of days from the first day of the year. 例如，对的第一个月的第一天返回 1，和的最后一天的最后一个月返回总天数该年度中，这是相同的值作为返回。For example, for the first day of the first month returns 1, and for the last day of the last month returns the total number of days in that year, which is the same value as that returned by . ## Examples 下面的代码示例显示几个组成部分的值方面日本历。The following code example displays the values of several components of a in terms of the Japanese calendar. remarks.format: ## Remarks 日语日历识别为每个皇帝 reign 一个纪元。The Japanese calendar recognizes one era for every emperor's reign. 当前纪元是平成纪元，始于公历 1989 年。The current era is the Heisei era, which began in the Gregorian calendar year 1989. 纪元名称通常会显示在年的前面。The era name is typically displayed before the year. 例如，公历 2001 年为日语日历年平成 13。For example, the Gregorian calendar year 2001 is the Japanese calendar year Heisei 13. 请注意，第一年的纪元称为"元年。"Note that the first year of an era is called "Gannen." 因此，公历 1989 年的日语日历平成元年。Therefore, the Gregorian calendar year 1989 was the Japanese calendar year Heisei Gannen. 此类将分配数字向纪元，如下所示：This class assigns numbers to the eras as follows: |GetEra 值GetEra value|纪元名称Era Name|纪元缩写Era Abbreviation|公历日期Gregorian Dates| |------------------|--------------|----------------------|---------------------| |44|平成 （平成）平成 (Heisei)|平 (H，h)平 (H, h)|年 1 月 8 日 1989 呈现January 8, 1989 to present| |33|昭和 (Showa)昭和 (Showa)|昭 （S、 s）昭 (S, s)|1926 年 12 月 25日，到 1989 年 1 月 7日日December 25, 1926 to January 7, 1989| |22|大正 (Taisho)大正 (Taisho)|大 （T、 t）大 (T, t)|1912 年 7 月 30日日到 1926 年 12 月 24日，July 30, 1912 to December 24, 1926| |11|明治 （明治）明治 (Meiji)|明 （M、 m）明 (M, m)|1868 年 9 月 8日日至 1912 年 7 月 29日日September 8, 1868 to July 29, 1912| 通常，类支持在年明治 1 (年 9 月 8，1868 公历)，即的值从 9 月 8 日期的属性。Ordinarily, the class supports dates from September 8 in the year Meiji 1 (September 8, 1868 of the Gregorian calendar), which is the value of the property. 但是，方法成功返回日期纪元从到 9 月 7 日明治 1 年 1 月 1 日 (1868 年 1 月 1，通过 1868 在公历日历年 9 月 7 日)。However, the method successfully returns the era for dates from January 1 through September 7 in the year Meiji 1 (January 1, 1868 through September 7, 1868 in the Gregorian calendar). 对于早于 1868 年 1 月 1 日公历日期，该方法将引发异常。For dates earlier than January 1, 1868 in the Gregorian calendar, the method throws an exception. ## Examples 下面的示例显示几个组成部分的值方面日本历。The following example displays the values of several components of a in terms of the Japanese calendar. remarks.format: ## Remarks 闰年日语日历中对应于为公历日历中的相同闰年。Leap years in the Japanese calendar correspond to the same leap years in the Gregorian calendar. 闰年公历日历中定义为公历年份整除的由 4 个，但如果它是由 100 可除外。A leap year in the Gregorian calendar is defined as a Gregorian year that is evenly divisible by four, except if it is divisible by 100. 但是，可被被 400 的公历年是闰年。However, Gregorian years that are divisible by 400 are leap years. 平 365 年天并且初始屏幕闰年有 366 天。A common year has 365 days and a leap year has 366 days. 闰日是仅在闰年中发生了一天。A leap day is a day that occurs only in a leap year. 例如，Nigatsu （年 2 月） 29 日是唯一的闰日。For example, the 29th day of Nigatsu (February) is the only leap day. ## Examples 下面的示例调用五年中每个纪元的第二个月份 （年 2 月） 的最后一天。The following example calls for the last day of the second month (February) for five years in each of the eras. remarks.format: ## Remarks 闰年日语日历中对应于为公历日历中的相同闰年。Leap years in the Japanese calendar correspond to the same leap years in the Gregorian calendar. 闰年公历日历中定义为公历年份整除的由 4 个，但如果它是由 100 可除外。A leap year in the Gregorian calendar is defined as a Gregorian year that is evenly divisible by four, except if it is divisible by 100. 但是，可被被 400 的公历年是闰年。However, Gregorian years that are divisible by 400 are leap years. 平 365 年天并且初始屏幕闰年有 366 天。A common year has 365 days and a leap year has 366 days. ## Examples 下面的示例调用五年中每个纪元。The following example calls for five years in each of the eras. remarks.format: ## Remarks 支持的最早日期类是年 9 月 8，为公元 1868，明治纪元的第一年中。The earliest date supported by the class is September 8, 1868 C.E., in the first year of the Meiji era. 通常，日期和时间使用的操作类引发异常在此日期之前的日期。Ordinarily, date and time operations that use the class throw an exception for dates before this date. 但是，某些成员，如方法，在年明治 1 支持从 1868 年 1 月 1 日到年 9 月月 7 日的日期。However, some members, such as the method, support dates from January 1, 1868 through September 7 in the year Meiji 1. ## Examples 下面的示例获取所日历支持的最早时间和最新日期。The following example gets the earliest and latest dates supported by the calendar. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法很有用，因为它可以将当前日历中的任何日期转换为公历日期。The method is useful because it can convert any date in the current calendar to a Gregorian calendar date. 公历日期可以随后用于，例如，比较不同日历中的日期或在特定日历中创建等效的日期。The Gregorian date can subsequently be used, for example, to compare dates in different calendars or create an equivalent date in a particular calendar.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法实现 。This method implements . 因为日语日历中的每年通常少于四位数，此实现始终返回的值`year`参数。Because the year in the Japanese calendar is typically less than four digits long, this implementation always returns the value of the `year` parameter. 支持两位数年份或四位数年份。 supports either a two-digit year or a four-digit year. 但是，有效年份通常表示为两个数字 (小于 100) 中。However, a valid year is generally represented as two digits (less than 100). 将两位数年份值传递会导致方法的值转换为一个四位数字值根据值，该值表示相应的纪元。Passing a two-digit year value causes the method to convert the value to a four-digit value according to the value representing the appropriate century. 如果应用程序提供了四位数字的值或零或负值，它会提供引发异常。If the application supplies a four-digit value, or if it supplies zero or a negative value, throws an exception.
